byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Nepal's government opens several heritage sites damaged by country's earthquake in effort to bolster tourism, despite urging by Unesco to delay opening two sites due to unsafe conditions.
lead_paragraph: Several monuments were opened to the public for the first time since an earthquake in April, even as the United Nations warned they may not be safe.

headline.main: Nepal Reopens Heritage Sites Despite U.N. Concerns
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Nepal: Sites Reopened to Visitors, Despite Criticism

snippet: Several monuments were opened to the public for the first time since an earthquake in April, even as the United Nations warned they may not be safe.
